timeline.event: Agreement to divest global Surface Solutions business for €800 million
Completion of Mirus Bio acquisition to enhance viral vector manufacturing
Publication of 2023 Annual Report: EBITDA pre of €5.9 billion delivered
Belen Garijo re-appointed as CEO and Chair of the Executive Board
Fiscal 2022 Results: Group net sales increase by 12.9% to €22.2 billion
Expansion of Life Science production site in Cork, Ireland (€440 million investment)
Expansion of Life Science production site in Wuxi, China (€100 million investment)
CEO Belen Garijo discusses US business and Life Sciences innovation at WEF

business_trends: Consolidation in Life Sciences viral vector market
Strategic focus on high-margin semiconductor and display materials
Expansion of production localization in China and Europe
Divestment of non-core specialty chemical business units
Recovery and return to profitable growth in 2024
decision_trends: Inorganic growth through specialized R&D acquisitions (Mirus Bio)
Portfolio sharpening via divestment of non-core assets (Surface Solutions)
Heavy capital expenditure in global manufacturing redundancy (Ireland, China)
Consistency in top-tier leadership with CEO re-appointment
strategic_summary: Merck KGaA is currently in a phase of strategic focus, divesting non-core chemical assets like Surface Solutions to double down on Healthcare, Life Sciences, and Electronics sectors. The company is actively expanding its global manufacturing footprint to ensure supply chain resilience while returning to profitable growth after a transitional 2023.
